Jesus Stills the Sea
On that [same] day, when evening had come, He said to them,  [of the Sea of Galilee].”
So leaving the crowd, they took Him with them, just as He was, in the boat. And other boats were with Him.
And a fierce windstorm began to blow, and waves were breaking over the boat, so that it was already being swamped.
But Jesus was in the stern, asleep [with His head] on the [sailor’s leather] cushion. And they woke Him and said to Him, “Teacher, do You not care that we are about to die?”
And He got up and [sternly] rebuked the wind and said to the sea,  And the wind died down [as if it had grown weary] and there was [at once] a great calm [a perfect peacefulness].
Jesus said to them,  [in Me]?”
They were filled with great fear, and said to each other, “Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey Him?”
